p: Dihedral angle profiles are used to examine the mobility of linking groups of polymer chains. Four consecutive atoms in the backbone are used to calculate the dihedral angle θ. The dihedral angle is defined as the angle between the two planes formed by the first three and last three atoms. For the most extended planar conformation, the dihedral angle θ is ±180°. Figure S3 illustrates the schematic diagrams of the analyzed atomic segments for the dihedral angle analysis.
